==Events==
* [[453 BC]] &ndash; [[Spring and Autumn period]]: The house of [[Zhao (state)|Zhao]] defeats the house of Zhi, ending the [[Battle of Jinyang]], a military conflict between the elite families of the [[Jin (Chinese state)|State of Jin]].
* [[413]] &ndash; Emperor [[Honorius (emperor)|Honorius]] signs an [[edict]] providing tax relief for the Italian provinces [[Province of Viterbo|Tuscia]], [[Campania]], [[Picenum]], [[Samnium]], [[Apulia]], [[Lucania]] and [[Calabria]], which were plundered by the [[Visigoths]].
* [[589]] &ndash; [[Reccared I]] summons the [[Third Council of Toledo]].
*[[1450]] &ndash; [[Jack Cade]]'s Rebellion: [[Kent]]ishmen revolt against King [[Henry VI of England|Henry VI]].
*[[1516]] &ndash; [[Trần Cảo Rebellion]]: A group of imperial guards, led by Trịnh Duy Sản, murdered Emperor [[Lê Tương Dực]] and fled, leaving the capital [[Hanoi|Thăng Long]] undefended.
*[[1541]] &ndash; [[Hernando de Soto]] reaches the [[Mississippi River]] and names  it ''Río de Espíritu Santo''.
*[[1788]] &ndash; The French [[Parlement]] is suspended to be replaced by the creation of forty-seven new courts.
*[[1794]] &ndash; Branded a traitor during the [[Reign of Terror]] by [[French Revolution|revolutionists]], French chemist [[Antoine Lavoisier]], who was also a [[tax collector]] with the ''[[Ferme Générale]]'', is tried, convicted, and [[guillotine]]d all on the same day in Paris.
*[[1821]] &ndash; [[Greek War of Independence]]: The Greeks defeat the Turks at the [[Battle of Gravia Inn]].
*[[1842]] &ndash; A train [[Versailles rail accident|derails and catches fire]] in Paris, killing between 52 and 200 people.
*[[1846]] &ndash; [[Mexican–American War]]: The [[Battle of Palo Alto]] &ndash; [[Zachary Taylor]] defeats a Mexican force north of the [[Rio Grande]] in the first major battle of the war.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Richmond, Virginia]] is named the capital of the [[Confederate States of America]].
*[[1877]] &ndash; At Gilmore's Gardens in New York City, the first [[Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show]] opens.
*[[1886]] &ndash; Pharmacist [[John Pemberton]] first sells a [[Carbonation|carbonated]] beverage named "[[Coca-Cola]]" as a [[patent medicine]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; The first games of the [[Italian football league system]] are played.
*[[1899]] &ndash; The [[Irish Literary Theatre]] in Dublin produced its first play.
*[[1901]] &ndash; The [[Australian Labor Party|Australian Labour Party]] is established.
*[[1902]] &ndash; In [[Martinique]], [[Mount Pelée]] erupts, destroying the town of [[Saint-Pierre, Martinique|Saint-Pierre]] and killing over 30,000 people. Only a handful of residents survive the blast.
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Paramount Pictures]] is founded.
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Edward George Honey]] first proposes the idea of a moment of silence to commemorate [[Armistice with Germany (Compiègne)|The Armistice]] of World War I, which later results in the creation of [[Remembrance Day]]. In the United States it was called Armistice Day and is now [[Veterans Day (United States)|Veterans Day]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; The [[Klaipėda Convention]] is signed formally incorporating [[Klaipėda Region]] (Memel Territory) into [[Lithuania]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; Attempting to make the first non-stop [[transatlantic flight]] from Paris to New York, French war heroes [[Charles Nungesser]] and [[François Coli]] disappear after taking off aboard ''[[The White Bird]]'' biplane.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Mohandas Gandhi]] begins a 21-day fast in protest against the British rule in India.
*[[1941]] &ndash; The German [[Luftwaffe]] launches a [[Nottingham Blitz|bombing raid on Nottingham and Derby]]
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of the Coral Sea]] comes to an end with [[Japanese Imperial Navy]] [[aircraft carrier]] aircraft attacking and sinking the [[United States Navy]] aircraft carrier {{USS|Lexington|CV-2|6}}. The battle marks the first time in the naval history that two enemy fleets fight without visual contact between warring ships.
*  1942   &ndash; World War II: Gunners of the Ceylon Garrison Artillery on Horsburgh Island in the [[Cocos Islands]] rebel in the [[Cocos Islands Mutiny]]. Their mutiny is crushed and three of them are executed, the only [[Commonwealth of Nations|British Commonwealth]] soldiers to be executed for mutiny during the Second World War.
*[[1945]] &ndash; Hundreds of [[Algeria]]n civilians are killed by French Army soldiers in the [[Sétif massacre]].
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: [[V-E Day]], combat ends in Europe. German forces agree in [[Reims, France]], to an [[German Instrument of Surrender, 1945|unconditional surrender]].
*  1945   &ndash; [[Halifax Riot|The Halifax Riot]] starts when thousands of civilians and servicemen rampage through [[City of Halifax|Halifax]].
*  1945   &ndash; End of the [[Prague uprising]], celebrated now as a national holiday in the Czech Republic.
*  1945   &ndash; Dissolution and [[German Instrument of Surrender|surrender of Nazi Germany]] and all its forces.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Estonia]]n school girls [[Aili Jõgi]] and [[Ageeda Paavel]] blow up the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] memorial which stood in front of the [[Bronze Soldier]] in [[Tallinn]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Army of the Republic of South Vietnam|South Vietnamese soldiers]] of Catholic President [[Ngo Dinh Diem]] [[Huế Phật Đản shootings|open fire on Buddhists]] defying a ban on the flying of the [[Buddhist flag]] on [[Vesākha|Vesak]], killing nine and sparking the [[Buddhist crisis]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; A plane crash at [[Connellsville, Pennsylvania]] kills [[Pennsylvania Attorney General]], Walter E. Alessandroni, his wife, and other state officials.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Philippines|Philippine]] province of [[Davao province|Davao]] is split into three: [[Davao del Norte]], [[Davao del Sur]], and [[Davao Oriental]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[Hard Hat Riot]] occurs in the [[Wall Street]] area of New York City as [[Blue-collar worker|blue-collar]] construction workers clash with [[Opposition to the Vietnam War|demonstrators protesting the Vietnam War]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Richard Nixon]] announces his order to place [[Naval mine|mine]]s in major [[North Vietnam]]ese ports in order to stem the flow of weapons and other goods to that nation.
*  1972   &ndash; Four Black September terrorists [[Sabena Flight 571 hijacking|hijack Sabena Flight 571]]. Israeli [[Sayeret Matkal]] commandos recapture the plane the following day.
*[[1973]] &ndash; A [[Wounded Knee incident|71-day standoff]] between federal authorities and the [[American Indian Movement]] members occupying the [[Pine Ridge Reservation]] at [[Wounded Knee, South Dakota]] ends with the surrender of the militants.
*[[1976]] &ndash; The rollercoaster [[Revolution (roller coaster)|Revolution]], the first steel coaster with a vertical loop, opens at [[Six Flags Magic Mountain]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; The first ascent of [[Mount Everest]] without supplemental oxygen, by [[Reinhold Messner]] and [[Peter Habeler]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; The [[World Health Organization]] confirms the eradication of [[smallpox]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] announces that it will [[1984 Summer Olympics boycott|boycott]] the [[1984 Summer Olympics]] in [[Los Angeles]].
*  1984   &ndash; Corporal [[Denis Lortie]] enters the [[National Assembly of Quebec|Quebec National Assembly]] and opens fire, killing three and wounding 13. [[René Jalbert]], [[sergeant-at-arms]] of the [[Deliberative assembly|assembly]], succeeds in calming him, for which he will later receive the [[Cross of Valour (Canada)|Cross of Valour]].
*  1984   &ndash; The [[Thames Barrier]] is officially opened.
*[[1987]] &ndash; The [[Loughgall Ambush]]: The [[Special Air Service|SAS]] kills eight [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] volunteers and a civilian during an ambush in [[Loughgall]], [[Northern Ireland]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; A fire at [[Illinois Bell]]'s Hinsdale Central Office triggers an extended [[1AESS]] [[network outage]] once considered the "worst telecommunications disaster in US telephone industry history".
*[[1997]] &ndash; A [[China Southern Airlines]] [[Boeing 737]] crashes on approach into [[Shenzhen Bao'an International Airport|Bao'an International Airport]], killing 35 people.
